channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation is changing the Republican party
item.description: Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation is forcing the Republican party to reckon publicly with what the political landscape will look like when President Trump leaves the White House.
item.content:encoded: Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation is forcing the Republican party to reckon publicly with what the political landscape will look like when President Trump leaves the White House.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Republican strategist on the state MAGA after Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Republican strategist Alex Conant about the state of the MAGA coalition following Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's decision to resign from Congress.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Republican strategist Alex Conant about the state of the MAGA coalition following Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's decision to resign from Congress.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: What foods make you happiest? It's not what you think
item.description: As you prepare for your holiday feast, here's something to consider. Research suggests there are certain foods that can help boost our moods and make us happier in the long-run.
item.content:encoded: As you prepare for your holiday feast, here's something to consider. Research suggests there are certain foods that can help boost our moods and make us happier in the long-run.
item.dc:creator: Michaeleen Doucleff

item.title: Give thanks for the discounts: The feast will cost a little less this year
item.description: Shoppers can be thankful for discounts on turkey and stuffing this year. While overall grocery prices are up, this year's Thanksgiving meal should cost a bit less than last year's.
item.content:encoded:
Shoppers can be thankful for discounts on turkey and stuffing this year. While overall grocery prices are up, this year's Thanksgiving meal should cost a bit less than last year's.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Over 250 children still missing in Nigeria after being abducted from Catholic school
item.description: More than 250 children are still being held by kidnappers in central Nigeria after they were abducted Friday from a Catholic boarding school.
item.content:encoded: More than 250 children are still being held by kidnappers in central Nigeria after they were abducted Friday from a Catholic boarding school.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: European nations clamor to be involved in Ukraine peace talks, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation forces GOP to rethink its politics, Israel and Hamas accuse each other of violating ceasefire.
item.content:encoded: European nations clamor to be involved in Ukraine peace talks, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's resignation forces GOP to rethink its politics, Israel and Hamas accuse each other of violating ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: A tale of two Chinas: Tech industry booms as workers face dim prospects
item.description: In China, two economic realities exist side of by side. The country's fast-growing technology sector is now leading the world in some aspects. Yet prospects for the average Chinese worker remain dim.
item.content:encoded: In China, two economic realities exist side of by side. The country's fast-growing technology sector is now leading the world in some aspects. Yet prospects for the average Chinese worker remain dim.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: New Orleans prepares for possible federal immigration crackdown
item.description: New Orleans residents are preparing for a possible deployment of U.S. Customs and Border Patrol agents to the region, even though the agency won't say whether or not it is actually coming.
item.content:encoded: New Orleans residents are preparing for a possible deployment of U.S. Customs and Border Patrol agents to the region, even though the agency won't say whether or not it is actually coming.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Ukrainians express concerns about a peace plan drafted by the U.S. and Russia
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was given a Thursday deadline to accept a new peace plan drafted by the U.S. and Russia that Ukraine had no input in, causing concerns for residents.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was given a Thursday deadline to accept a new peace plan drafted by the U.S. and Russia that Ukraine had no input in, causing concerns for residents.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Books We Love: NPR staffers' favorite nonfiction books of 2025
item.description: NPR's Books We Love returns with about 380 titles handpicked by NPR staff and critics. Reporter Andrew Limbong shares this year's nonfiction favorites with Michel Martin.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Books We Love returns with about 380 titles handpicked by NPR staff and critics. Reporter Andrew Limbong shares this year's nonfiction favorites with Michel Martin.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong
